alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Renville; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:37PM CDT until May 07 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Carver, Dakota and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Renville and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Lac qui Parle and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. .Showers and thunderstorms have produced a decent amount of rainfall in spots today, however not widespread enough to cause any issues with our downwards trend in river levels. We expect to continue to see a downward trend despite further showers through the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 885.0 feet, Flood waters begin to reach the alley way along the river at the foot bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 885.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 915 PM CDT Friday was 885.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 885.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 885.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 884.8 feet on 07/04/2013. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
